intro: You are assisting Mrs Finlay with her lunch. She seems unsure about whether she is hungry and needs gentle encouragement to eat. Use empathetic communication to help her feel comfortable and supported while ensuring she eats safely.
description_html:
This scenario focuses on safe feeding practices with a resident who has dysphagia (swallowing difficulties). You will practice encouraging nutrition while monitoring for safety concerns.

Learning objectives:

  • Ensure proper positioning before feeding
  • Check food temperature before serving
  • Recognize signs of swallowing difficulty
  • Feed at an appropriate pace with small amounts
  • Know when to escalate concerns

resident.name: Mrs Finlay
goals: accept encouragement to eat a small amount
eat small amounts with carer assistance
accept reminder not to talk while eating
request tea with milk but no sugar
must_disclose: tea preference: dash of milk, no sugar
refusals: will not eat if not comfortable
will not eat food that is too hot
will not accept food if carer rushes feeding

safety.if_red_flag_then: pause feeding; escalate to nurse; adjust posture or check care plan

actions.title: Adjust pillow
actions.prompt: You carefully adjust the pillow behind Mrs Finlay to help her sit more comfortably upright for eating.

actions.title: Bring lunch tray
actions.prompt: You bring the lunch tray over and place it on the table in front of Mrs Finlay. The meal is chicken with mashed potato.

actions.title: Test food temperature
actions.prompt: You test a small amount of the food to check that it's not too hot before offering it to Mrs Finlay.

actions.title: Offer spoonful
actions.prompt: You offer a small spoonful of food to Mrs Finlay, waiting for her to open her mouth.

actions.title: Bring ice cream
actions.prompt: You bring over a bowl of ice cream for dessert.

actions.title: Prepare tea
actions.prompt: You prepare a cup of tea with a dash of milk and no sugar, as Mrs Finlay requested.
